    <span id="ctl00_MainContent_DetailedOutput"><h1 class="title">Lich</h1>A wizard whose insatiable desire for arcane power eclipsed their mortal life, the lich is a truly devious and versatile spellcaster.<br /><br /><b><u><a href="Skills.aspx?ID=5&General=true">Recall Knowledge - Undead</a></u> (<u><a href="Skills.aspx?ID=13">Religion</a></u>)</b>: DC 35<h1 class="title"><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=282">Lich</a><span style="float:right;">Creature 12</span></h1><a target="_blank" href="Images\Monsters\Lich_Lich.png"><img class="thumbnail" src="Images\Monsters\Lich_Lich.png"></a><span alt="Rare Trait" class="traitrare" title="This rarity indicates that a rules element is very difficult to find in the game world. A rare feat, spell, item or the like is available to players only if the GM decides to include it in the game, typically through discovery during play. Creatures with this trait are rare. They typically can’t be summoned. The DC of Recall Knowledge checks related to these creatures is increased by 5."><a href="Traits.aspx?ID=137">Rare</a></span><span alt="Neutral Evil" class="traitalignment" title="Neutral Evil">NE</span><span alt="Medium" class="traitsize" title="Medium">Medium</span><span alt="Undead Trait" class="trait" title="Once living, these creatures were infused after death with negative energy and soul-corrupting evil magic. When reduced to 0 Hit Points, an undead creature is destroyed. Undead creatures are damaged by positive energy, are healed by negative energy, and don’t benefit from healing effects."><a href="Traits.aspx?ID=160">Undead</a></span><br /><b>Source</b> <a href="https://paizo.com/products/btq01y0m?Pathfinder-Bestiary" target="_blank" class="external-link"><i>Bestiary pg. 221</i></a><br /><b>Perception</b> +20; darkvision<br /><b>Languages</b> <a href="Languages.aspx?ID=12"><u>Abyssal</a></u>, <a href="Languages.aspx?ID=13"><u>Aklo</a></u>, <a href="Languages.aspx?ID=1"><u>Common</a></u>, <a href="Languages.aspx?ID=2"><u>Draconic</a></u>, <a href="Languages.aspx?ID=4"><u>Elven</a></u>, <a href="Languages.aspx?ID=19"><u>Infernal</a></u>, <a href="Languages.aspx?ID=20"><u>Necril</a></u>, <a href="Languages.aspx?ID=11"><u>Undercommon</a></u><br /><b>Skills</b> <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=2"><u>Arcana</a></u> +28, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=4"><u>Crafting</a></u> +24 (can craft magic items), <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=5"><u>Deception</a></u> +17, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=6"><u>Diplomacy</a></u> +19, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=13"><u>Religion</a></u> +22, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=15"><u>Stealth</a></u> +20<br /><b>Str</b> +0, <b>Dex</b> +4, <b>Con</b> +0, <b>Int</b> +6, <b>Wis</b> +4, <b>Cha</b> +3<br /><b>Items</b> <a href="Equipment.aspx?ID=356"><u>staff of fire (greater)</u></a>, <i>potion of <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Spells.aspx?ID=164">invisibility</a></i>, <i>scroll of <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Spells.aspx?ID=338">teleport</a></i><hr /><b>AC</b> 31, <b>Fort</b> +17, <b>Ref</b> +21, <b>Will</b> +23; +1 status to all saves vs. positive<br /><b>HP</b> 190 (negative healing, rejuvenation); <b>Immunities</b> death effects, disease, paralyzed, poison, unconscious; <b>Resistances</b> cold 10, physical 10 (except magic bludgeoning)<br /><b>Frightful Presence</b> (<a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=206">aura</a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=60">emotion</a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=68">fear</a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=106">mental</a>) 60 feet, DC 29<br /> <b>Counterspell</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Reaction" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\Reaction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Reaction" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\Reaction_I.png"> <b>Trigger</b> A creature casts a spell the lich has prepared. <b>Effect</b> The lich expends a prepared spell to counter the triggering creature’s casting of that same spell. The lich loses its spell slot as if it had cast the triggering spell. The lich then attempts to counteract the triggering spell.<hr /><b>Speed</b> 25 feet<br /><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Melee</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png"> hand +24 (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=179"><u>finesse</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=103"><u>magical</a></u>), <b>Damage</b> 4d8 negative plus paralyzing touch</span><b>Arcane Prepared Spells</b> DC 36, attack +26; <b>6th</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=33">chain lightning</a></u></i>, <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=87">dominate</a></u></i>, <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=353">vampiric exsanguination</a></u></i>; <b>5th</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=42">cloudkill</a></u></i>, <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=47">cone of cold</a></u></i> (x2), <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=364">wall of ice</a></u></i>; <b>4th</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=69">dimension door</a></u></i>, <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=78">dispel magic</a></u></i>, <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=118">fire shield</a></u></i>, <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=125">fly</a></u></i>; <b>3rd</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=26">blindness</a></u></i>, <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=173">locate</a></u></i>, <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=180">magic missile</a></u></i>, <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=354">vampiric touch</a></u></i>; <b>2nd</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=108">false life</a></u></i>, <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=197">mirror image</a></u></i>, <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=256">resist energy</a></u></i>, <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=271">see invisibility</a></u></i>; <b>1st</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=122">fleet step</a></u></i>, <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=244">ray of enfeeblement</a></u></i> (x2), <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=345">true strike</a></u></i>; <b>Cantrips</b> <b>(6th)</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=66">detect magic</a></u></i>, <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=177">mage hand</a></u></i>, <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=190">message</a></u></i>, <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=245">ray of frost</a></u></i>, <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=280">shield</a></u></i><br /><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Drain Phylactery</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Free Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\FreeAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Free Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\FreeAction_I.png">  6th level</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Paralyzing Touch</b> (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=11"><u>arcane</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=38"><u>curse</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=93"><u>incapacitation</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=117"><u>necromancy</a></u>) DC 32</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Steady Spellcasting</b> If a reaction would disrupt the lich’s spellcasting action, the lich attempts a DC 15 flat check. On a success, the action isn’t disrupted.</span><h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Advice and Rules" title="Sidebar - Advice and Rules" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_1_AdviceAndRules.png"> Lich Crafting</h3>Liches spend a good deal of their downtime crafting magic items. In particular, a lich will create items that help it defeat and overcome known problems. This fact can prove especially dangerous if the PCs encounter a lich but fail to destroy its phylactery, for the next time they encounter the lich, it will likely have just the right tools to overcome their defenses.<h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Treasure and Rewards" title="Sidebar - Treasure and Rewards" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_5_TreasureAndRewards.png"> Lich Treasure</h3>The lair of a lich is usually filled with several magical treasures, particularly items that the undead can use based on its spellcasting abilities. Scrolls, wands, and staves are quite common, as are books of lore and tomes containing entirely new spells.<h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Additional Lore" title="Sidebar - Additional Lore" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_2_AdditionalLore.png"> Unique Lichdom</h3>The exact ritual, ingredients for deadly concoctions, and magical conditions required to become a lich are unique and different for every living creature. Understanding a spellcaster’s path to lichdom can help, but is no guarantee of success for others.<h2 class="title">All Monsters in "<a href="MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=68">Lich</a>"</h2><table class="inner"><tr><td><b>Name</b></td><td><b>Level</b></td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=283">Demilich</a></td><td>15</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=282">Lich</a></td><td>12</td></tr></table><h1 class="title"><a href="MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=68">Lich</a></h1><b>Source</b> <a href="https://paizo.com/products/btq01y0m?Pathfinder-Bestiary" target="_blank" class="external-link"><i>Bestiary pg. 220</i></a><br />To gain more time to complete their goals, some desperate spellcasters pursue immortality by embracing undeath. After long years of research and the creation of a special container called a phylactery, a spellcaster takes the final step by imbibing a deadly concoction or casting dreadful incantations that transform them into a lich. While most undertake this drastic plan to continue their work or fulfill some long-term plan, others become liches because they fear death or to fulfill some malevolent purpose, such as long-sworn revenge. Regardless, the result is permanent and carries with it the potential to alter history—both that of those who transform themselves and of the countless mortals that will inevitably suffer as a result of a lich’s new power.<br /><br /> After its metamorphosis, a lich often finds some quiet place to dwell, typically protected by a variety of guardians and traps, for two primary purposes. First, a lich requires solitude in order to plan its elaborate schemes, and second, few mortals (if any) deign to interact with these legendarily corrupt necromancers. One reason begets the other, as the self-imposed isolation of a lich often drives the lich insane, further solidifying its separation from civilization. The longer a lich lives, the more meticulous a planner it becomes, secreting itself within a labyrinth of deadly puzzles, misdirection, and monsters. A lich’s servants and guardians are absolutely loyal, either due to their nature (such as constructs or other undead) or as a result of compulsion using powerful magic. Many liches go mad, in time, and the nature of a lich’s lair is a good indicator of the undead’s current mental state.<br /><br /> For all the protections it arrays around itself, a lich will go to greater lengths to guard its phylactery, as it knows that the destruction of this magical container spells doom for the lich. A lich is notoriously difficult to bargain with, though the threat of damaging its phylactery is a sure way to gain the upper hand in such a negotiation. <h2 class="title">Creating A Lich</h2> A lich can be any type of spellcaster, as long as it has the ability to perform a ritual of undeath as the primary caster (which can usually be performed only by a spellcaster capable of casting 6th-level spells). To create a lich, follow these steps.<br /> Increase the spellcaster’s level by 1 and change its statistics as follows.<br /> Increase spell DCs and spell attack roll by 2. <h3 class="title">Lich Abilities</h3> A lich gains the undead trait and becomes evil. Liches lose all abilities that come from being a living creature.<br /> A lich gains the following abilities.<br /> <b>Darkvision</b><br /> <b>Saving Throws</b> +1 status bonus to all saves vs. positive<br /> <b>Negative Healing</b><br /> <b>Rejuvenation</b> (<a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=11">arcane</a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=117">necromancy</a>) When a lich is destroyed, its soul immediately transfers to its phylactery. A lich can be permanently destroyed only if its phylactery is found and destroyed.<br /> <b>Immunities</b> death effects, disease, paralyzed, poison, unconscious<br /> <b>Resistances</b> cold 20, physical 15 (except magic bludgeoning)<br /> <b>Frightful Presence</b> (aura, emotion, fear, mental) 60 feet, DC 30<br /> <b>Hand of the Lich</b> All liches have a hand unarmed attack that deals 1d8 negative damage for every 3 levels and in icts a paralyzing touch. This attack has the finesse trait.<br /> <b>Drain Phylactery</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Free Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\FreeAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Free Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\FreeAction_I.png"> <b>Frequency</b> once per day; <b>Effect</b> The lich taps into its phylactery’s power to cast any arcane spell up to the highest level the lich can cast, even if the spell being cast is not one of the lich’s prepared spells. The lich’s phylactery doesn’t need to be present for the lich to use this ability.<br /> <b>Paralyzing Touch</b> (<a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=11">arcane</a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=38">curse</a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=93">incapacitation</a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=117">necromancy</a>) A creature damaged by the lich’s hand Strike must succeed at a Fortitude save against the lich’s spell DC – 4. The creature becomes paralyzed for 1 round on a failure. On a critical failure, the creature is paralyzed permanently, falls prone, and seems dead. A DC 25 Medicine check reveals the victim is alive. <h3 class="title">Alternate Lich Abilities</h3> Although the abilities above are standard for a lich, you can create a more unusual lich by substituting any one of the following abilities for frightful presence, hand of the lich, Drain Phylactery, or paralyzing touch.<br /> <b>Blasphemous Utterances</b> (<a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=11">arcane</a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=206">aura</a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=61">enchantment</a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=106">mental</a>) 10 feet. The lich is accompanied by a constant echo of blasphemous murmurs and tainted whispers. A creature in the aura takes a –2 circumstance penalty to saves against mental effects and can’t take actions that have the concentrate trait unless they succeed at a DC 10 flat check. Failing this check wastes the action.<br /> <b>Cold Beyond Cold</b> The lich’s hand Strike deals cold damage instead of negative, and instead of being paralyzed, the target is slowed 2. A successful Fortitude save reduces this to slowed 1 (or negates it on a critical success).<br /> <b>Dark Deliverance</b> The lich has resistance to positive equal to its level.<br /> <b>Siphon Life</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Reaction" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\Reaction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Reaction" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\Reaction_I.png"> <b>Trigger</b> The lich deals damage with its hand Strike. <b>Effect</b> The lich regains Hit Points equal to half the damage dealt.<br /> <b>Void Shroud</b> (<a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=206">aura</a>, <t>death, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=117">necromancy</a>) 30 feet. The lich is surrounded by an aura of death, drawing forth souls to be consumed by the lich’s constant hunger. Living creatures in the emanation take a –2 status penalty to saves against fear and death effects. In addition, any creature that starts its turn in the area gains the doomed 1 condition unless it succeeds at a Will save against the lich’s spell DC – 4.<h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Related Creatures" title="Sidebar - Related Creatures" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_4_RelatedCreatures.png"> Associated Monsters</h3>Undead minions are very common companions for a lich or demilich. Liches prefer mindless undead, that do what they’re told and don’t interrupt the lich’s studies with useless conversation. Liches with a knack for crafting are also fond of surrounding themselves with construct servitors and guardians, such as golems.</span>

  <script>
      initiateToggle(document.getElementById('theme-toggle'));
      initializeMenuToggle(document.getElementById('minMaxMenu'));
      var initializeSearch = function (search) {
          var button;
          var text;
          if (search.firstElementChild.classList.contains('search-input'))
              text = search.firstElementChild;
          if (search.lastElementChild.classList.contains('search-input'))
              text = search.lastElementChild;
          if (search.firstElementChild.classList.contains('search-button'))
              button = search.firstElementChild;
          if (search.lastElementChild.classList.contains('search-button'))
              button = search.lastElementChild;

          if (search) {
              search.addEventListener('keypress', function (e) {
                  if (e.keyCode == 13) {
                      e.preventDefault();
                      if (text.value != null && text.value.length > 0)
                          window.location = window.location.origin + "/Search.aspx?query=" + text.value;
                  }
              })
          }
          if (button) {
              button.addEventListener('click', function (e) {
                  window.location = window.location.origin + "/Search.aspx?query=" + text.value;
              });
          }
      };
      var initializeExpand = function (toggle) {
          var targetAttrString = "[data-target='" + toggle.dataset.toggle + "']";
          //target = menu to be collapsed
          var target = document.querySelector(targetAttrString);
          toggle.addEventListener('click', function () {
              var expanded = target.classList.contains('expanded');
              expanded = !expanded;
              if (expanded) {
                  //hide other in group if exists
                  if (target.dataset.group) {
                      var otherExpanded = document.querySelector('.expanded[data-group="' + target.dataset.group + '"]');
                      if (otherExpanded) {
                          otherExpanded.classList.remove('expanded');
                      }
                  }
                  target.classList.add('expanded');
              } else {
                  target.classList.remove('expanded');
              }
          });
      };
      (function () {
          //toggles = link that expands/collapses target
          var toggles = document.querySelectorAll('[data-toggle]');
          toggles.forEach(function (toggle) {
              initializeExpand(toggle);
          });
          //searches
          var searches = document.querySelectorAll('.search');
          searches.forEach(function (search) {
              initializeSearch(search);
          });
      })();
  </script>
